I purchased E-RA Organics because my children have extremely sensitive skin. We must be cautious regarding fragrance, coloring and other ingredients that are often found in major brand baby products even though they are sensitive skin products. For this reason, I typically make a mixture of shea butter and coconut oil. It's inconvenient, expensive and honestly Grandma won't use the home made concoction at her house. Enter E-RA healing balm. It is colorless and doesn't have any odor. It feels thick and similar to coconut oil(solid) with a slight waxy feel. It's not super greasy.
I first purchased the diaper balm for chaffing on my daughter's thighs. It worked remarkably. So I went on to purchase the healing balm for eczema dry patches on my daughters back, neck and scalp. With Afro Latino children, the skin is already needing lots of moisture. Often store bought ointments and lotions don't moisturize the skin enough OR they leave my child looking like a greased Thanksgiving Butterball. E-RA Organics Honeybuns healing balm was a great middle ground, it does not leave a greasy feeling while still moisturizing the skin. Within 3-4 uses, I could see the areas of irritation/dryness begin to get smaller and since have disappeared altogether.

It's gotten colder outside and I also began using this on my older, 6 year old son, for irritation on his red runny nose. He said it doesn't burn when applied and it helps make his nose "happy". So if you need a great skin solution but don't want to worry about sensitive skin/allergy, fragrance, additives, or just chemical poop storms being applied to your baby's skin, this is the product for you :)

I bought this healing balm mainly for my 3 year old, who gets pretty bad eczema, especially once it starts getting colder out. Even though I knew it was only 2 oz., the container was a little smaller than I anticipated (it fit right in the middle of my hand). I think that it smells great (think shea butter) but it is extremely greasy. My son doesn't mind the greasy feeling but I would have rated it lower if it had been for me because I really don't like feeling greasy. This balm worked great for the eczema on my son's shoulder/back but, as stated by the company, with natural ingredients it did take about a week of applying it to show results. It worked well being that the eczema was on his back and the balm could be covered by a shirt. I would worry about the greasiness rubbing off onto other surfaces if it had been used on his arm or leg etc. My husband (this review is under his account, not mine!) has a dairy intolerance and gets red, dry skin on his face often. He used this on a red patch on his forehead and it definitely helped take out the redness after several applications. I also used it on my dry, cracked heels and it helped them feel smoother. While I don't like the greasy feeling at all, I do like that it smells nice and does work well for the things we have used it for (and a wide-variety of uses!)
